register.name: BBIC_PAD_CONTROL_RFIC_CTRL[0]
register.comment: Control register for pad RFIC_CTRL

register.name: BBIC_PAD_CONTROL_RFIC_CTRL[1]
register.comment: Control register for pad RFIC_CTRL

register.name: BBIC_PAD_CONTROL_RFIC_CTRL[2]
register.comment: Control register for pad RFIC_CTRL

register.name: BBIC_PAD_CONTROL_RFIC_CTRL[3]
register.comment: Control register for pad RFIC_CTRL

register.name: PIO_INVERT_ENABLES
register.comment: Set a bit to 1 to invert the driven output.

register.name: PIO_INPUT_STATUS
register.comment: The PIO input status(after loopback).

register.name: PIO_OUTPUT_STATUS
register.comment: The PIO output status.

register.name: PIO_IRQ_SELECT[0]
register.comment: Register group destinations: 0 = WLAN, 1 = WPAN.

register.name: PIO_IRQ_INVERT[0]
register.comment: Invert the output IRQ level if this is set to 1.

register.name: PIO_IRQ_SELECT[1]
register.comment: Register group destinations: 0 = WLAN, 1 = WPAN.

register.name: PIO_IRQ_INVERT[1]
register.comment: Invert the output IRQ level if this is set to 1.

register.name: DEBUG_SERIALISER_CFG[0]
register.comment: Main Serialiser Config

register.name: DEBUG_SERIALISER_8B10B_CFG[0]
register.comment: 8B10B mode Serialiser Config

register.name: DEBUG_SERIALISER_CFG[1]
register.comment: Main Serialiser Config

register.name: DEBUG_SERIALISER_8B10B_CFG[1]
register.comment: 8B10B mode Serialiser Config

register.name: DEBUG_SERIALISER_SW_DATA
register.comment: SW Driven data for serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG
register.comment: Configuration for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG2
register.comment: Second configuration register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG3
register.comment: Third configuration register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_CFG4
register.comment: Fourth configuration register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_DECODE
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_SYNC
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_DISP
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_ERROR_COUNTER_8B10B_CRC
register.comment: Count of errors since last cleared

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_STATUS
register.comment: Status register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_MONITOR
register.comment: Monitor register for the RFIC debug de-serialisers

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_LEO_CFG
register.comment: Configuration for Leo mode capture - overrides others

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_LEO_INDEX
register.comment: Input pin indicies for Leo mode capture, from {FM_SPDY, RFIC_CTRL}, default to: Data=RFIC_CTRL 5:2, SyncClk=FM_SPDY

register.name: DEBUG_DESERIALISER_LEO_STATUS
register.comment: Leo Mode status

block.name: axi_monitor
block.comment: Monitor transactions on the AXI bus.

register.name: AXI_MON_ENABLE
register.comment: Enable the AXI monitor. Enabled by default because turning it on at any point would mean probably missing something and getting out of sync.

register.name: AXI_MON_ID_WRITE_MASK
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which AXI ID(s) bits to to check in burst transactions. If 0, all masters are monitored. If mask is non-zero then if a matching value in AXI_MON_ID_VALUE for the bits set here is true then monitoring occurs.

register.name: AXI_MON_ID_WRITE_VALUE
register.comment: Value to match the incoming AXI ID against.

register.name: AXI_MON_ID_READ_MASK
register.comment: Bitfield indicating from which AXI ID(s) bits to to check in burst transactions. If 0, all masters are monitored. If mask is non-zero then if a matching value in AXI_MON_ID_VALUE for the bits set here is true then monitoring occurs.

register.name: AXI_MON_ID_READ_VALUE
register.comment: Value to match the incoming AXI ID against.

register.name: AXI_MON_INST_READ_BURST_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of read burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_INST_READ_BYTE_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes transferred in the read burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_INST_WRITE_BURST_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of write burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_INST_WRITE_BYTE_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes transferred in the write burst transactions on the AXI write channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_DATA_READ_BURST_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of read burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_DATA_READ_BYTE_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes transferred in the read burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_DATA_WRITE_BURST_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of write burst transactions on the AXI read channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_DATA_WRITE_BYTE_COUNT
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes transferred in the write burst transactions on the AXI write channel.

register.name: AXI_MON_OUTSTANDING_STATUS
register.comment: Dynamic status of outstanding reads/writes

register.name: AXI_MON_OUTSTANDING_STATUS_MAX
register.comment: Maximum value of outstanding reads/writes since last clear.

register.name: AXI_MON_OUTSTANDING_STATUS_MAX_CLEAR
register.comment: Clear status of outstanding reads/writes

register.name: BAAW_ERROR_STATUS
register.comment: Error status flags for BAAW accesses

register.name: BAAW_ERROR_ADDR_AR
register.comment: Read address channel address

register.name: BAAW_ERROR_ADDR_AW
register.comment: Write address channel address

register.name: BAAW_ERROR_INFO_AR
register.comment: Other error burst info

register.name: BAAW_ERROR_INFO_AW
register.comment: Other error burst info

register.name: BAAW_ERROR_CLEAR
register.comment: Error clear flags for BAAW accesses

register.name: SYS_VERSION
register.comment: Connected to CHIP_VERSION_ID from the sysctrl register block.

register.name: SYS_PERT_REGISTER_HASH
register.comment: Contains a 32bit hash of all the PERT register tree source used in the PMU

register.name: PMU_INT_SLEEP_READY_MASK_CLEAR
register.comment: Bitfield indicating which SLEEP_READY interrupt sources contribute to the interrupt generation. Setting 1 in a field enables that source. Setting 0 ignores it for interrupt generation purposes. All fields are enabled by default. - Clear register bits/read register bits

register.name: PMU_INT_SLEEP_READY_MASK_SET
register.comment: Bitfield indicating which SLEEP_READY interrupt sources contribute to the interrupt generation. Setting 1 in a field enables that source. Setting 0 ignores it for interrupt generation purposes. All fields are enabled by default. - Set register bits/read register bits

register.name: PMU_INT_SOURCE_WAKE_EVENT_SEL_PULSE
register.comment: Set to 1 to select a single-cycle pulse for the deep sleep wake event rather than a level.

register.name: PMU_PIO_DRIVE
register.comment: PIO drive

register.name: PMU_PIO_DRIVE_ENABLE
register.comment: PIO drive enable

register.name: PMU_PIO_STATUS
register.comment: PIO status

register.name: RTC_IRQ_EN
register.comment: RTC Interrupt enable. Any writes to this register also clear any RTC interrupt.

register.name: PMU_RFIC_STATUS
register.comment: Identifies the cause of the RFIC_EVENT interrupt. Each one can be selectively enabled by the MASK registers

register.name: PMU_RFIC_MASK
register.comment: Allows RFIC_CTRL inputs to be enabled to generate an RFIC_EVENT interrupt

register.name: PMU_RESOURCE_REQ
register.comment: Outgoing resource requests from WLBT to AP/CP. Leave the requests asserted until no longer required.

register.name: PMU_RESOURCE_ACK
register.comment: Outgoing resource request status/acknowledgement

register.name: PMU_AP2WB_REQ
register.comment: Incoming requests from AP to WLBT.

register.name: PMU_WB2AP_ACK
register.comment: Outgoing acknowledgement from WLBT to AP.

register.name: PMU_EXT_RESET_REQUEST
register.comment: Requests and status out of WLBT

register.name: PMU_MISC_CONTROL
register.comment: Miscellaneous control signals

register.name: TCKR_FRAC_INC
register.comment: Binary fraction to increment the fractional incrementer on every clock cycle. Defaults to 76.8MHz.

register.name: QCH_FORCE_EN
register.comment: Q-channel manager force clock enable

register.name: PMU_BAAW_QCH_CTRL
register.comment: Controls for CFG bus BAAW SFR blocks QCH

register.name: PMU_BAAW_QCH_STATUS
register.comment: Status for CFG bus BAAW SFR blocks QCH

register.name: PMU_IPC
register.comment: IPC comms with WLAN and WPAN.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_CMD
register.comment: This register is used to trigger events in the sleep block

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS
register.comment: A free-running slow clock counter

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT
register.comment: When the timer matches this count a deep sleep wakeup event will be triggered

register.name: SLEEP_STATUS
register.comment: Sleep output from M0 core. Indicates the PMU is executing a Wait For Interrupt (WFI) instruction.

register.name: WATCHDOG_ENABLE
register.comment: Writing '1' enables the watchdog regardless of its previous state and resets its state machine to WATCHDOG_STATUS_FSM_ENABLED.

register.name: WATCHDOG_DISABLE
register.comment: Writing the 3 disable codes in sequence to this register will disable the watchdog. Writing WATCHDOG_DEBUG_CODE3 instead of WATCHDOG_DISABLE_CODE3 will set the watchdog into debug mode. Each correct code written will advance the WATCHDOG_STATUS by 1 until it reaches 3. A status of 3 indicates that the watchdog has been disabled A status of 4 indicates that the watchdog is in debug mode. If an incorrect code is written at any time, the status will revert to 0 (enabled). The watchdog will not stop counting down until all three codes have been written correctly.

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 2 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 37 hours

register.name: WATCHDOG_KICK
register.comment: Writing to this register causes the countdown value to be reset to the value stored in WATCHDOG_DELAY. WATCHDOG_DELAY is captured into the slow clock domain after a cycle or two. The register fields WATCHDOG_STATUS_KICK_PENDING and WATCHDOG_STATUS_SLOW_KICK_PENDING indicate if this register has already been written and an update is currently pending. Writing this register toggles a flag inside the watchdog logic so writing it a second time before the first has successfully propagated will clear the toggle and cancel the kick.

register.name: WATCHDOG_STATUS
register.comment: Watchdog status compound register.

register.name: ALIVE_RESET
register.comment: Resets for main MXL140 clock generator, WLBT toplevel

register.name: ALIVE_CLOCK_ENABLE
register.comment: Enables for ALIVE clock generator

register.name: ALIVE_CLOCK_ENABLE2
register.comment: Enables for ALIVE clock generator

register.name: WLAN_CLOCK_ENABLE
register.comment: Controls for main clock generator

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_0
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_1
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_2
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_3
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_4
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_5
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_6
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_7
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_8
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_9
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_10
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_11
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_12
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_13
register.comment: PLL controls

register.name: WPLL_FVALUE
register.comment: PLL F controls

register.name: WPLL_KVALUE
register.comment: PLL K controls Redundant on 6165

register.name: PD_CONTROL_WLAN
register.comment: Controls the state of switches, isolation and reset in WLAN power domain

register.name: PD_CONTROL_WPAN
register.comment: Controls the state of switches, isolation and reset in WPAN power domain

register.name: PD_CONTROL_WLAUX
register.comment: Controls the state of switches, isolation and reset in WLAUX power domain

register.name: PD_CONTROL_WLM[0]
register.comment: Controls the state of switches, isolation and reset in WLP/WLS power domain. Use an array to help software.

register.name: PD_CONTROL_UCPUPRI
register.comment: Controls the state of switches, isolation and reset in UCPUPRI power domain

register.name: PD_STATUS
register.comment: Indicates the status of the switches in each power domain

register.name: RAM_POWER_CONTROL
register.comment: The power-down and retention controls for all the RAMs in the system.

register.name: RAM_POWER_CONTROL_UCPU[0]
register.comment: The power-down and retention controls for all the RAMs in the UCPUs.

register.name: RAM_POWER_CONTROL_UCPU[1]
register.comment: The power-down and retention controls for all the RAMs in the UCPUs.

register.name: PAD_RETENTION
register.comment: Pad retention controls.

register.name: PROC_CONFIG
register.comment: WLAN PD processor platform configuration.

register.name: PROC_CONFIG_WPAN
register.comment: WPAN PD processor platform configuration.

register.name: WLAN_PD_RMP_BOOT_ADDR2
register.comment: Second WLAN_PD remapper region 0 address. Selectable using PMU bit PROC_CONFIG_WLAN_REMAP_BOOT_ADDR_SEL.

register.name: WPAN_PD_RMP_BOOT_ADDR2
register.comment: Second WPAN_PD remapper region 0 address. Selectable using PMU bit PROC_CONFIG_WLAN_REMAP_BOOT_ADDR_SEL.

register.name: DEBUG_SOURCE_SELECT
register.comment: Select the ouput on DEBUG_OUT[15:0] on the PMU

register.name: SWEEPER_CONTROL
register.comment: Controls the Sweeper modules in WLBT. Set to 1 to start a sweeper clean. Return to 0 once the ACK for that sweeper is set.

register.name: SWEEPER_STATUS
register.comment: Status from the Sweeper modules in WLBT. '1' in a field indicates Sweeper completion.

register.name: DRCG
register.comment: Dynamic Root Clock gating feature of SLSI blocks. Set to '1' to enable block clock gating. Otherwise the clocks will run all the time.

register.name: PIO_ALV
register.comment: These control the FEMCTRL output pins if PIO_ALV_EN is set to PIO_ALIVE_EN_PMU.

register.name: PIO_ALV_EN
register.comment: Set to appropriate values to control the source for the FEMCTRL pins.

register.name: QREQ_OFF_OVR
register.comment: Q-channel request overrides. These are actually clock gate enables to bypass the Q-channel managers.

register.name: CLK_GATING_EN
register.comment: Clock gating enables.

register.name: CLK_GATE_OVR
register.comment: Clock Gate overrides. Set to '1' to enable the clocks for each of the specified blocks.

register.name: CLK_GATE_OVR2
register.comment: Clock Gate overrides. Set to '1' to enable the clocks for each of the specified blocks.

register.name: PCH_REQ
register.comment: P-channel manager power down request. Set to '1' to request power down and '0' to power up. Handily inverted logic.

register.name: PCH_ACK
register.comment: P-channel manager power down acknowledge. 1 = powered-down, 0 = powered-up.

register.name: BLK_WLBT_TOPW_LH_CTRL
register.comment: Portal PCIE->WLAN source longhop control

register.name: BLK_WLBT_PERT_LH_CTRL
register.comment: WLAN->PMU PERT destination longhop control

register.name: APM_LH_CTRL
register.comment: Portal WLAN APM destination longhop control

register.name: APM_LH_STATUS
register.comment: APM CBUS LH status

register.name: MIF_LH_CTRL
register.comment: Portal WLAN MIF destination longhop control

register.name: MIF_LH_STATUS
register.comment: MIF DBUS LH status

register.name: PORTAL_NIC_QCH_CTRL
register.comment: Portal NIC-400 QCH managerp control

register.name: CS_DEBUG
register.comment: Register-controllable CoreSight debug authentication bits.

register.name: TCKR_OFFSET
register.comment: Set the offset to apply to the 32-bit ticker.

register.name: PMU_TCKR_VALUE
register.comment: The current value of the 32-bit ticker.

register.name: PMU_TCKR_VALUE_FINE
register.comment: The fine time (intra-microsecond) captured when the timer is disabled. There's no CDC on this so make sure the ticker is disabled when this register is read.

register.name: PMU_TCKR_VALUE_FINE_FRAC
register.comment: The fine time (intra-microsecond) captured when the fractional timer is disabled. There's no CDC on this so make sure the ticker is disabled when this register is read.

register.name: PMU_TCKR_RETAIN_FINE_TIME_EN
register.comment: 1 = Don't reset the fine time if the ticker is disabled. This allows it to restart from where it left off. 0 = Reset when the ticker is re-enabled.

register.name: CFG_AP_MAILBOX_FROM_AP
register.comment: AP-accessible mailbox register. Read-only from PMU.

register.name: CFG_AP_MAILBOX_TO_AP
register.comment: AP-accessible mailbox register. Read-only from AP.

register.name: PMU_REGS_FAILED_ADDRESS
register.comment: Address of a failed register access.

register.name: PMU_REGS_STATUS
register.comment: Observe the AHB bus failure status. Write to a field to clear it.

register.name: PMU_CLK_REQ_EXTEND_CYCLES
register.comment: The number of clock cycles to extend the request for the various clock gates after the activity is complete.

register.name: SYS_CTRL
register.comment: VDD_ALIVE-powered system config register

register.name: ZIPPY_CFG[0]
register.comment: ZIPPY control register for each ZIPPY_BB_TOP instance (0=BT, 1=WLAN-A, 2=WLAN-B)

register.name: ZIPPY_CFG[1]
register.comment: ZIPPY control register for each ZIPPY_BB_TOP instance (0=BT, 1=WLAN-A, 2=WLAN-B)

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_LH_CFG
register.comment: ZIPPY control register for each ZIPPY_BB_TOP instance (0=BT, 1=WLAN-A, 2=WLAN-B)

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_BB2RF_QCH_CTRL
register.comment: Control bits for the BT Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_BB2RF_QCH_STATUS
register.comment: BT Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_BB2RF_PCH_CTRL
register.comment: Control bits for the BT Distributer longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_BB2RF_PCH_STATUS
register.comment: BT Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_BB2RF_LH_STATUS
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_RF2BB_QCH_CTRL
register.comment: Control bits for the BT Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_RF2BB_QCH_STATUS
register.comment: BT Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_RF2BB_PCH_CTRL
register.comment: Control bits for the BT Combiner longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_RF2BB_PCH_STATUS
register.comment: BT Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WPAN_RF2BB_LH_STATUS
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_LH_CFG[0]
register.comment: ZIPPY control register for each ZIPPY_BB_TOP instance (0=BT, 1=WLAN-A, 2=WLAN-B)

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_QCH_CTRL[0]
register.comment: Control bits for the BT Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_QCH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: WLP Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_PCH_CTRL[0]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLP Distributer longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_PCH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: WLP Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_LH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_QCH_CTRL[0]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_QCH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_PCH_CTRL[0]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_PCH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_LH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_QCH_CTRL[0]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLP Events longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_QCH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: WLP Events longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_PCH_CTRL[0]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLP Events longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_PCH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: WLP Events longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_LH_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_LH_CFG[1]
register.comment: ZIPPY control register for each ZIPPY_BB_TOP instance (0=BT, 1=WLAN-A, 2=WLAN-B)

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_QCH_CTRL[1]
register.comment: Control bits for the BT Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_QCH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: WLP Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_PCH_CTRL[1]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLP Distributer longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_PCH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: WLP Distributer longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_BB2RF_LH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_QCH_CTRL[1]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_QCH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_PCH_CTRL[1]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_PCH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: WLAN Primary Combiner longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_RF2BB_LH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_QCH_CTRL[1]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLP Events longhop (zippy_top side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_QCH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: WLP Events longhop (zippy_top side) Q-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_PCH_CTRL[1]
register.comment: Control bits for the WLP Events longhop (ZippyTop side) PCH and QCH managers.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_PCH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: WLP Events longhop (zippy_top side) P-channel manager status.

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_EVENTS_LH_STATUS[1]
register.comment: Current status of useful longhop bus bits.

register.name: ZIPPY_MUX_CH20_CFG[0]
register.comment: Select which flags (if any) are muxed onto channels[2:0] of this ZIPPY instance. Channels[2:0] are only used by WPAN, of which there's only one instance. Besides from NONE, no two registers should be set to the WPAN value.

register.name: ZIPPY_MUX_CH20_CFG[1]
register.comment: Select which flags (if any) are muxed onto channels[2:0] of this ZIPPY instance. Channels[2:0] are only used by WPAN, of which there's only one instance. Besides from NONE, no two registers should be set to the WPAN value.

register.name: ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL0_CFG[0]
register.comment: Select which flags (if any) are muxed onto channels[5:3] of this ZIPPY instance. These channels are used by WLAN, which is the more complicated case as there's multiple PHY instances, and in some cases (PRI/SEC)) they can have multiple PORTs of flags. Besides from the value NONE, no two registers between ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL0_CFG and ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL1_CFG should be set to the same value.

register.name: ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL0_CFG[1]
register.comment: Select which flags (if any) are muxed onto channels[5:3] of this ZIPPY instance. These channels are used by WLAN, which is the more complicated case as there's multiple PHY instances, and in some cases (PRI/SEC)) they can have multiple PORTs of flags. Besides from the value NONE, no two registers between ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL0_CFG and ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL1_CFG should be set to the same value.

register.name: ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL1_CFG[0]
register.comment: Select which flags (if any) are muxed onto channels[5:3] of this ZIPPY instance. These channels are used by WLAN, which is the more complicated case as there's multiple PHY instances, and in some cases (PRI/SEC)) they can have multiple PORTs of flags. Besides from the value NONE, no two registers between ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL0_CFG and ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL1_CFG should be set to the same value.

register.name: ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL1_CFG[1]
register.comment: Select which flags (if any) are muxed onto channels[5:3] of this ZIPPY instance. These channels are used by WLAN, which is the more complicated case as there's multiple PHY instances, and in some cases (PRI/SEC)) they can have multiple PORTs of flags. Besides from the value NONE, no two registers between ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL0_CFG and ZIPPY_MUX_CH53_WL1_CFG should be set to the same value.

register.name: FREQ_COUNT_CTRL
register.comment: Control the frequency counter.

register.name: FREQ_COUNT_STATUS
register.comment: Check the status and results of frequency counter.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[0]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[1]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[2]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[3]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[4]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[5]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[6]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: SYS_SEMAPHORES[7]
register.comment: An array of single-bit semaphores available to any accessor that can see the PERT tree.

register.name: PMU_NMI
register.comment: Cause non-maskable interrupts to occur on other CPUs.

register.name: PMU_HW_CLK_SWITCH
register.comment: Control the hardware clock switcher.

register.name: PMU_HW_CLK_SWITCH_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the hardware clock switcher.

register.name: PMU_WLM_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Configuration register for BLK_WLP (and BLK_WLS, if necessary)

register.name: PMU_TCXO_FREQ
register.comment: Set the TCXO frequency in MHz for the Ticker. Defaults to 52MHz.

register.name: PMU_SCRATCH[0]
register.comment: PMU scratch registers for software.

register.name: PMU_SCRATCH[1]
register.comment: PMU scratch registers for software.

register.name: PMU_SCRATCH[2]
register.comment: PMU scratch registers for software.

register.name: PMU_SCRATCH[3]
register.comment: PMU scratch registers for software.

register.name: CFG_BUS_LH_STATUS
register.comment: Status of LH bus wires controlling initialisation.

register.name: PMU_APM_PWR_MODE
register.comment: APM Power ACK Mode

register.name: ZIPPY_WLAN_SW_SEL
register.comment: Controls the muxing of Zippy software overrides

register.name: BLK_WLAN_LH_CTRL
register.comment: Control the WLAN TOPW longhop remotely to allow PMU to shut it down.

register.name: BLK_WLAN_LH_STAT
register.comment: Observe the WLAN TOPW longhop remotely to allow PMU to shut it down.

register.name: WPAN_SWEEPER_CTRL
register.comment: Control the WPAN sweepers remotely to allow PMU to shut WPAN down.

register.name: WPAN_SWEEPER_STAT
register.comment: Observe the WPAN sweepers remotely to allow PMU to shut WPAN down.

block.name: zippy_bb_0
block.comment: ZIPPY BB control and status registers

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_TIMEOUTS_I0
register.comment: Time out control for register read data and write acknowledges (if enabled) to be returned from the RF IC

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_TRANSPORT_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY baseband transport configuration. The matching configuration must also be set up in the RF chip

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_PRIORITY_INC_RATE_I0
register.comment: Configure the rate at which priority increases for unserviced channels.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS0_CFG_I0
register.comment: Type 0 (BT) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS1_CFG_I0
register.comment: Type 1 (BT) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS2_CFG_I0
register.comment: Type 2 (BT) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS3_CFG_I0
register.comment: Type 3 (WLAN) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS4_CFG_I0
register.comment: Type 4 (WLAN) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS5_CFG_I0
register.comment: Type 5 (WLAN) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_CFG_I0
register.comment: Address/data frame configuration and write ack mask

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_CMD_PORT_DISABLE_I0
register.comment: Disanable CMD Interrupt Port.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_READ_VALID_PORT_DISABLE_I0
register.comment: Disanable READ VALID Interrupt Port.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_RFIC_PORT_DISABLE_I0
register.comment: Disanable RFIC Interrupt Port.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_ERROR_PORT_DISABLE_I0
register.comment: Disanable ERROR Interrupt Port.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_EN_I0
register.comment: Interrupt sources enable.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Status of Interrupt sources.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_APB_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Status of ZIppy register access

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_COUNTS_I0
register.comment: Local BB counters for data from BB to RF and RF to BB. TO be compared with equivalent ones in the RFIC

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DEBUG_CTRL_I0
register.comment: Control of Zippy debug and logging facilities

register.name: ZIPPY_MUTEX_I0
register.comment: Single resource mutual exclusion lock.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_I0[0]
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_I0[0]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_I0[0]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_I0[1]
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_I0[1]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_I0[1]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_I0[2]
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_I0[2]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_I0[2]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_CFG2_I0
register.comment: General Configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_TIMEOUTS2_I0
register.comment: Extra Time out controls.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[0]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[1]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[2]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[3]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[4]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[5]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[6]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[7]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[8]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[9]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[10]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[11]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[12]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[13]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[14]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I0[15]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_SELFTEST_DATA_I0
register.comment: Used only for Selftest. Requires an external Zippy loop back. 32bit writes will return to back this register.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_BACK2BACK_I0
register.comment: Back to back frame control for sample edge switching.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_LRATE_MARGIN_I0
register.comment: A read of this register in Slow mode will return the uncertainty margin to the rising and falling edge.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_LRATE_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Configuration for Line Rate Sampler.

block.name: zippy_bb_1
block.comment: ZIPPY BB control and status registers

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_CFG_I1

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_CMD_PORT_DISABLE_I1
register.comment: Disanable CMD Interrupt Port.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_READ_VALID_PORT_DISABLE_I1

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_RFIC_PORT_DISABLE_I1

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_ERROR_PORT_DISABLE_I1

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_EN_I1

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_STATUS_I1
register.comment: Status of Interrupt sources.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_CLEAR_I1

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_COUNTS_I1
register.comment: Local BB counters for data from BB to RF and RF to BB. TO be compared with equivalent ones in the RFIC

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DEBUG_CTRL_I1
register.comment: Control of Zippy debug and logging facilities

register.name: ZIPPY_MUTEX_I1
register.comment: Single resource mutual exclusion lock.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_I1[0]
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_I1[0]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_I1[0]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_I1[1]
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I1[11]

register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I1[13]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I1[14]

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_RFIC_ADD_BOUNDS_I1[15]
register.comment: Max size of each of RFIC PSEL blocks. Total must be less than 2048

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_SELFTEST_DATA_I1
register.comment: Used only for Selftest. Requires an external Zippy loop back. 32bit writes will return to back this register.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_BACK2BACK_I1
register.comment: Back to back frame control for sample edge switching.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_LRATE_MARGIN_I1
register.comment: A read of this register in Slow mode will return the uncertainty margin to the rising and falling edge.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_LRATE_CONFIG_I1
register.comment: Configuration for Line Rate Sampler.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_ADDR_CTRL_MPORT_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT)Remote register access address and controls. The bottom 16 bits of this register (PSEL and ADDR) are actually the bottom 16 bits of the byte address of the RFIC register to be accessed (from HTML docs for example)

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WRITE_DATA_MPORT_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT) Data to write to remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred. Unwritten bytes are unchanged, if the destination register is larger than the number of bytes written

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WRITE_DATA_MASK_MPORT_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT) Any bits cleared in this register will not be written at the destination register. Action is performed by doing a automatic Read-Modify-Write operation. There is no Read-interrupt on completion however the READ data (in the Read-Modify-Write cycle) is saved in the ZIPPY_BB_READ_DATA_ register.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_READ_DATA_MPORT_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT) Data returned from the remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_DISABLE_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Disable interrupt/read enable status

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_ENABLE_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Enable interrupt/read enable status

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Clear interrupt/read pending interrupt status

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_RAW_I0
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Read incoming interrupt status

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_ADDR_CTRL_MPORT_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT)Remote register access address and controls. The bottom 16 bits of this register (PSEL and ADDR) are actually the bottom 16 bits of the byte address of the RFIC register to be accessed (from HTML docs for example)

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WRITE_DATA_MPORT_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT) Data to write to remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred. Unwritten bytes are unchanged, if the destination register is larger than the number of bytes written

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WRITE_DATA_MASK_MPORT_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT) Any bits cleared in this register will not be written at the destination register. Action is performed by doing a automatic Read-Modify-Write operation. There is no Read-interrupt on completion however the READ data (in the Read-Modify-Write cycle) is saved in the ZIPPY_BB_READ_DATA_ register.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_READ_DATA_MPORT_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MULTIPORT) Data returned from the remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_DISABLE_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Disable interrupt/read enable status

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_ENABLE_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Enable interrupt/read enable status

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_CLEAR_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Clear interrupt/read pending interrupt status

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_MPORT_RAW_I1
register.comment: ZIPPY (MultiPORT) Interrupt controller. - Read incoming interrupt status
